intro: Stachytarpheta restingensis var. hispidula, commonly known as the hispid hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The variety hispidula is distinguished by its dense pubescence and unique floral structure.
